content.rendered:
Char Dham Yatra is a holy Hindu pilgrimage that combines spirituality and religion with traveling to the scenic parts of the remote Garhwal regions. It involves offering prayer to the 4 holy ancient temples of Kedarnath, Badrinath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri. The historical and mythological accounts of these legendary shrines surpass time and ages and its significance is acknowledged ever since the place had become accessible to devotees. All these temples forming this pilgrimage are located in the scenic Garhwal Himalayan regions makes for not only a spiritual journey but also for a thrilling and exciting adventure. Visiting these temples, according to legend, will provide complete freedom from the karmic cycle of birth and rebirth i.e. Moksha or salvation, which is the ultimate goal of every human life.

Kedarnath, the highest Jyotirlinga in the world is dedicated to Lord Shiva, Badrinath Or Badri Vishal is dedicated to Lord Vishnu while Gangotri is dedicated to goddess Ganga and Yamunotri is dedicated to goddess Yamuna, all these put together makes for one of the most soulful and wholesome journeys. All these places of worship in this pilgrimage circuit mark something significant or the other like the starting point of Yamuna River or the original commencement point of Ganga River etc. when the pilgrimage begins during the onset of summer season people and devotees from all over the world and Hindus from across the globe make it their motive to go on the Yatra at least once in their lifetime.

Although Char Dham Tourism is one journey that may prove to be challenging and tough due to the difficult terrain consisting of jagged landscape, in the end, it will prove to be very fulfilling and worth it. The idea and concept of this holy journey were put forth by the great sage, seer, and philosopher Adi Shankaracharya during the 7th – 8th century when he had noticed that Hinduism was plunging as a result of constant conquests by various different religious groups and conquerors. In an attempt to reignite the feeling of spirituality and oneness among the general Indian population, and it worked like a charm and this becomes clearer every year.

Being situated in the hills a typical Chardham Travel Guide will only take you for Darshan to these temples but will also enable you to be a part of the charming beauty that surrounds this magnificent and pious place. When the pilgrimage shuts down for 6 months of the winter season the entire regions get encapsulated in snowmaking traveling impossible in such inhospitable conditions. The presiding idols are transferred to their winter homes where the winter pilgrimage Yatra takes place for the convenience of the devotees. Exploring these ancient places of worship that holds such a mystical charm is an experience of a lifetime. No matter where you are coming from r even if you are not a believer still taking this journey will enlighten you and leave you feeling like you have accomplished something very sacred and powerful in your life.

BadrinathView More

KedarnathView More

GangotriView More

YamunotriView More

About Chardham

There are numerous customs in Hindu traditions and customs but the concept of taking a pilgrimage is common to every religion. One such important pilgrimage or Yatra in Hinduism is the iconic Char Dham Yatra which can be dated back to the 7th or 8th century. The primary reason for devotees to go on this divine journey on the pious Garhwal hills of Devbhumi Uttarakhand is the belief that after its completion of the visit to the 4 holy ancient temples of Kedarnath, Badrinath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri, the pilgrims are granted salvation or moksha which is the liberation or complete freedom from the karmic cycle of birth and rebirth.

There are 4 primary temples concerning the pilgrimage which were re-established by Adi Shankaracharya in an attempt to reignite the feeling of Hinduism among the masses of India which he felt was lost. This was his way of binding the Indian population one string and making them feel like they are a part of this world together. The historical and mythological significance of the temples in this circuit is immense. Kedarnath is famous as the ancient and the highest Jyotirlinga in the world whose creation is credited to the Pandava brothers. Badrinath is said to have been built on the place where Nar and Narayan and even lord Vishnu himself had meditated. Gangotri, on the other hand, marks the place of origin of Ganga River according to the mythological accounts, which is named Bhagirathi River here and king Bhagirathi is said to have worshipped Goddess Ganga.

Finally, Yamunotri as the name suggests marks the place of birth of Yamuna River.

When the pilgrimage opens for the duration of 6 months the entire regions get flocked with devotees and pilgrims from across the globe. The pilgrim towns thrive during this time and it goes on till the winter months when by Diwali it shuts down due to inhospitable climatic conditions. Other than that one gets to experience the remarkable power of the higher lord above amidst the remarkable and charming natural beauty which is found in abundance around here. It is a highly revered holy journey that should not be taken lightly since it takes the pilgrims through tough terrain and challenging conditions so one must be prepared at all times during this travel experience. The Char Dham Yatra is considered to be one of the most spiritual awakenings and the holy journey one could undertake in a lifetime.

As compared to ages ago, this Yatra has turned into one of the most significant and popular journeys one could take on the hills. It is now also attracting a number of adventure seekers and solitude lovers since there are places to explore in and around the Char Dham Temples which offer this opportunity to just let yourself relax, sit back and let your hair down. Char Dham is not just a sacred pilgrimage it is an experience in itself that teaches you the value of the higher power and divinity that this place has to offer.

Yatra Packages

Char Dham Tour Packages are available in a variety of combinations ranging from Do Dham, Teen Dham or even Char Dham By Helicopter Yatra. These packages are created to cater to all the need and requirement of the traveler or the pilgrim. The packages are also designed in a way to accommodate pilgrims from different walks of life and backgrounds. All the Char Dham Packages are very flexible and can be customized according to the need of the pilgrim. Remember to book your package for Char Dham way before hand and make a place for you and your loved ones for an experience of a lifetime.

Things to Do

Char Dham Yatra is not just about religion and spirituality; it is about having a deeper and introspective experience within yourself. From going on treks and hikes up to the temple and offering your Darshan to the gods and goddesses every aspect of this journey will be very special. There is a plethora of things for one to do and indulge in since here you can go mountaineering, camping activities, rafting, bungee jumping, etc. there something for everything to do and for people of all ages. Explore the hidden jewels, feel closer to nature and have a memorable holiday which will remain etched forever in your heart.
